item.title: At Sunday services, taking stock and moving forward in Texas
item.description: Scott Detrow speaks with KERA's James Hartley about his reporting on how people gathered at church services Sunday to reflect after the deadly flash floods which killed more than 120 people in central Texas.
item.content:encoded: Scott Detrow speaks with KERA's James Hartley about his reporting on how people gathered at church services Sunday to reflect after the deadly flash floods which killed more than 120 people in central Texas.

item.title: Wildfire destroys a historic Grand Canyon lodge and other structures
item.description: A park official said the visitor center, the gas station, a waste water treatment plant, an administrative building and some employee housing were among the 50 to 80 structures lost.

item.title: Jannik Sinner wins Wimbledon, Italy's first singles champion
item.description: Italy's Jannik Sinner defeated defending champion Carlos Alcaraz to win his first Wimbledon title. Sinner is the first Italian to win the tournament.

item.title: Senate committee details failures by Secret Service in preventing Trump shooting
item.description: The Senate Homeland Security Committee said the Secret Service's "lack of structured communication was likely the greatest contributor to the failures" at the Pennsylvania rally last summer.

item.title: Nigeria's former President Muhammadu Buhari dies at 82
item.description: Nigeria's former president Muhammadu Buhari — who once ruled as a military dictator before returning decades later as an elected leader — has died at 82.

item.title: The claim that cloud seeding caused the Texas floods is untrue — and actively harmful
item.description: More and more voices, including politicians, say that cloud seeding — or man-made ways of increasing precipitation — caused the deadly floods in Texas. Experts say this is damaging public trust.
